Generation III.Ruby: Nicknamed “the bully of the sea,” Sharpedo is widely feared. Its cruel fangs grow back immediately if they snap off. Just one of these Pok é mon can thoroughly tear apart a supertanker.
Generation III.Sapphire: Sharpedo can swim at speeds of up to 75 mph by jetting seawater out of its backside. This Pok é mon 's drawback is its inability to swim long distances.
Generation III.Emerald: The vicious and sly gangster of the sea. Its skin is specially textured to minimize drag in water. Its speed tops out at over 75 miles per hour .
Generation III.FireRed: The ruffian of the seas, it has fangs that crunch through iron. It swims by jetting water from its rear.
Generation III.LeafGreen: The ruffian of the seas, it has fangs that crunch through iron. It swims by jetting water from its rear.

Generation IV.Diamond: Its fangs rip through sheet iron. It swims at 75 mph and is known as "The Bully of the Sea."
Generation IV.Pearl: Its fangs rip through sheet iron. It swims at 75 mph and is known as "The Bully of the Sea."
Generation IV.Platinum: Its fangs rip through sheet iron. It swims at 75 mph and is known as "The Bully of the Sea."
Generation IV.HeartGold: It can swim at speeds of 75 mph by jetting seawater through its body. It is the bandit of the sea.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: It can swim at speeds of 75 mph by jetting seawater through its body. It is the bandit of the sea.

Generation V.Black: Its fangs rip through sheet iron. It swims at 75 mph and is known as "The Bully of the Sea."
Generation V.White: Its fangs rip through sheet iron. It swims at 75 mph and is known as "The Bully of the Sea."

Generation VI.X: Its fangs rip through sheet iron. It swims at 75 mph and is known as "The Bully of the Sea."
Generation VI.Y: It can swim at speeds of 75 mph by jetting seawater through its body. It is the bandit of the sea.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Nicknamed "the bully of the sea," Sharpedo is widely feared. Its cruel fangs grow back immediately if they snap off. Just one of these Pokémon can thoroughly tear apart a supertanker.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Sharpedo can swim at speeds of up to 75 mph by jetting seawater out of its backside. This Pokémon's drawback is its inability to swim long distances.

Generation VII.Sun: The spines sprouting from its head are transformed fangs. If they're injured or broken off, the spines will regenerate countless times.
Generation VII.Moon: As a consequence of Mega Evolution, its combative instincts exploded. The yellow marks it bears are scars from a long history of battles.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: The yellow patterns it bears are old scars. The energy from Mega Evolution runs through them, causing it sharp pain and suffering.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: The moment it charges into its opponent, sharp spikes pop out of Sharpedo's head, leaving its opponent with deep wounds.

Generation VIII.Sword: As soon as it catches the scent of its prey, Sharpedo will jet seawater from its backside, hurtling toward the target to attack at 75 mph .
Generation VIII.Shield: This Pokémon is known as the Bully of the Sea. Any ship entering the waters Sharpedo calls home will be attacked—no exceptions.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: Its fangs rip through sheet iron. It swims at 75 mph and is known as the Bully of the Sea.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Its fangs rip through sheet iron. It swims at 75 mph and is known as the Bully of the Sea.
